Thread Class Reference

#include <thread.hpp>

Detailed Description

A thread.

The 'main function' of each thread is stored in the Machine::globals list of the machine. The first thread corresponds to the last global, the second thread to the second last global, and so on.

A thread can be triggered and activated. It is called 'pending' when it is either triggered, activated or both. The Machine::run() starts the execution of the next pending Thread, Round-robin style.

Definition at line 36 of file thread.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

void Thread::trigger ( )

Trigger this thread.

The specified thread will be executed once.

There is no waiting line. Triggering an already triggered thread has no effect.

Definition at line 49 of file thread.hpp.

void Thread::activate ( )

Activate this thread.

The specified thread will be executed infinitely, until deactivation.

Definition at line 57 of file thread.hpp.
